TopicTitle: How do you pronounce different *KSP* things?

Articles.Content:
Rather than start a thread for every planet and moon in the Kerbol system, I have take the burden upon myself to create a single master pronunciation thread to rule all other pronunciation threads.

How do you pronounce Eeloo? Ee-lew. 

How do you pronounce Jool? Jewel.

How do you prononce Laythe? Lathe.

How do you pronounce Vall? Vall, as in Valhalla.

How do you pronounce Tylo? Tie-low.

How do you pronounce Bop? Bop, like pop.

How do you pronounce Pol? Pol, like the -ol in tylenol, not the oll in poll.

how do you pronounce Dres? Drez, dre like in dress, rez as in resolution.

How do you pronounce Duna? Doo-nah man. 

How do you pronounce Ike? Like Ike.

How do you pronounce Kerbin? Ker-bin.

How do you pronounce Mun? Mun, as in done.

How do you pronounce Minmus? Min-mus.

How do you pronounce Eve? Eve, as in evolution.

How do you pronounce Gilly? Fish gill-ee.

How do you pronounce Moho? Like Soho, yo. 

How do you pronounce Kerbol? Ker-bol, like Pol.

What are your strange pronunciations?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-23T03:49:38Z" title="07/23/2015 03:49  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 23, 2015</time> by Robotengineer**
  
Clarifying that it is KSP only. Edit2: put \*KSP\* in wrong place.

E-lew for Eeloo

Moe-hoe for Moho

Eve for Eve

Ker-bin for Kerbin

M-uhn for Mun

Min-mus for Minmus

Dune-a for Duna

Ike for Ike

Dress for Dres

Jewel for Jool

Lay-thhh for Laythe

Val for Vall

Ty-low for Tylo

Bop for Bop

Poll for Pol

Gill-e for Gilly.

As a native southerner, "pin" and "pen" are pronounced the same (both like "pin").

"Ben," "been," and "bin" are all pronounced the same way.

"Mayonnaise" has only two syllables (sounds like "Man-ase")

There are other notable differences between the way I pronounce things and the way everyone around me (no longer living in the South) does, I don't consider them "strange pronunciations," I just consider these people to be flat-out wrong.
Isn't Mun supposed to be pronounce like "moon?"

> 
> Isn't Mun supposed to be pronounce like "moon?"

Nope, it's M-un.
I always thought Ike is romanized Japanese.

> Nope, it's M-un.

I took german in college, I have a feel for what it sounds like ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Certainly closer to rhyming with loon than fun. Also, it's The Mun, as it is "the Moon" (Apollo visited the moon, not moon, and Viking visited Mars, not the Mars).

So I say moon.

I'm not a huge Starbucks fan, but I order small, medium and large there, when I happen to go (never ordered a large, I have to say).
Laythe, as in lathe
Laythe shall always be Lay-thhh in my installs.

I thought this was another anti/joke-thread.

But this seems for realz.

On topic: I pronounce the names like an English-speaker would eventhough I'm non-English.

Agreed except the in game name for the star at the center of the planetary system is called "the sun" - although I think it would be better if it WERE officially "Kerbol" and

It's MOON. While the umlaut is not always present, it does appear in some cases as MÃ‚ÂÃ‚ÂÃƒÂ¼n and therfore has the ue sound so it is perhaps at best Mewn.

Certainly not Mun as in rhymes with one.

EDIT: Thinking on it, I've been saying Duna more or less like Scott Manley does, even before I ever saw one of his videos and even though I don't have a Scottish accent.

I consulted IPA-spelled words often, but to know how to read IPA is almost a study of its own.

Probably main strange pronounciation for me is

Jool - Jul, like in July

Also:

Ike - Ee-ke. Ee - just long e, wall-e style "Eeeeva!", and ke - no analog in english. Like in Catch, but with more plain sound instead of a...

I have some IPA in the 'fridge, had I known this was a good idea, I'dve had that with dinner instead of wine.

[http://vocaroo.com/i/s1MHREsMxmGw](http://vocaroo.com/i/s1MHREsMxmGw)

Done in order from OP's list.

**Nova's official unofficial may-or-may-not-be-considerable-as-canon pronunciation list:**

Eeloo: Ee-lue

Jool: "Tool" with a J.

Laythe: Like "Faith" with an L.

Vall: "Fall" with a V.

Tylo: Tie-low.

Bop: The sound made when I hit people who pronounce Laythe using two syllables.

Pol: Poll and Pohl have equal acceptance.

Dres: Drezz.

Duna: Doo-na, or if you're British, Dew-na.

Ike: Like, like "like".

Kerbin: Godfellow Trampoline Mangione Breadstick Defiler.

Mun: Like "moon", Muhn is also acceptable when the umlaut is misplaced or unavailable. I just call it "the moon", however.

Minmus: Min-musz

Eve: Eve, like the name, biblical figure, or album by The Alan Parsons Project

Gilly: Gill-E (like wall-e but with a gill instead of a wall)

Moho: Mo-ho.

Kerbol: Ker-bohl/Ker-bowl

> 
> How do you pronounce Eve? Eve, as in evolution.

I was really confused until I remembered evolution could be said with a long E
